thread.title: Alab nips Singapore, keeps third spot
thread.title_full: Alab nips Singapore, keeps third spot

title: Alab nips Singapore, keeps third spot
text:
Philippine Daily Inquirer / 02:51 AM February 14, 2017 FILE – Alab Pilipinas’ Ray Parks squeezes into two Singapore Slingers’ defenders. Photo from the Asean Basketball League Facebook page 
It was one of those victories that Alab Pilipinas coach Mac Cuan hopes will be the start of something special for the Filipino club, which has struggled to put together a string of solid performances in the 2017 Asean Basketball League. 
With their imports rising to the challenge in the extra period, Alab hacked out a thrilling 64-62 overtime victory Sunday night over host Singapore Slingers to tighten their grip of third spot at OCBC Arena. 
“We needed wins like this, to finish games this way because most of the games in the playoffs will be like this,” said Cuan after Alab beat the Slingers for the second straight time to rise to 7-4. ADVERTISEMENT 
Sampson Carter nailed the go-ahead three point play off a Jeric Fortuna pass with 20 seconds remaining in the overtime period, before Jens Knuttel stole the ball from Leon Kwek on the Slingers’ final play to preserve the road win for Alab. Alab takes on Malaysia on Friday at Baliwag Star Arena in Bulacan. — CEDELF P. TUPAS
